title: Ticket #4468: Schedd core dump on reconfig
description:
Here's the basic info from the RUST ticket:

This morning, at 09:59 UTC, we received an automated email that condor_schedd had crashed on our ITB glidein factory, and we were hoping you could help us understand the cause and prevent future occurrences. The email we got read like this: 

  Date: Fri, 27 Jun 2014 09:59:16 +0000


  This is an automated email from the Condor system
  on machine "glidein-itb.grid.iu.edu".  Do not reply.


  "/usr/local/glidecondor/sbin/condor_schedd" on "glidein-itb.grid.iu.edu"
  exited with status 1.
  Condor will automatically restart this process in 10 seconds.

This notification came less than 12 hours after I upgraded the factory in question to use HTCondor 8.2.0. We haven't seen warnings like this on previous Condor versions, so we suspect something endemic to this version.
remarks:
2014-Jul-18 10:59:39 by wenger:
Hmm -- I was looking at the log files to attach the relevant segment to this ticket, and I noticed that each time the schedd core dumped, it was just after a ClassAd log rotation (and a SIGHUP). I hadn't noticed the log rotation aspect previously...

2015-Feb-11 16:04:06 by bbockelm:
Is this ticket still valid? Per the lack of recent complaints from the factory, I propose closing.

2020-Jun-29 14:27:26 by blin:
